Name: Relief of a Priest at Worship
Description: This low-relief depicts the profile of a priest wearing a simple garment and chain and a priestly skullcap. He is raising his hand in worship. The relief is finely engraved, and contains detailed facial features and fingers. According to priestly traditions, priests could only wear garments made of white linen. In the winter, they wore wool under the linen as an exception. High priests could wear animal's skins, such as panther skin.
